com.pb.sawdust.io

Class LineSeparatorPrintWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.io.Writer
      • java.io.PrintWriter
        • com.pb.sawdust.io.LineSeparatorPrintWriter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.io.Flushable, java.lang.Appendable, java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public class LineSeparatorPrintWriter
extends java.io.PrintWriter
    The LineSeparatorPrintWriter provides a PrintWriter whose line separator can be set. This avoids the restriction of using the default (platform specific) line-separator as with java.io.PrintWriter. Instances of this class are constructed through static factory methods so that checked expections can be wrapped as runtime exceptions.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class java.io.PrintWriter

      • Fields inherited from class java.io.Writer

    • Method Detail

      • println

        public void println()
        Terminates the current line by writing the line separator string. The line separator is specified when constructing this class and is not necessarily the default value as used by this class' parent.
        Overrides:
        println in class java.io.PrintWriter

      • lineSeparatorPrintWriter

        public static LineSeparatorPrintWriter lineSeparatorPrintWriter(java.lang.String fileName,
                                                java.lang.String lineSeparator)
        Construct a writer without automatic line flushing specifying the file to write to.
        Parameters:
        fileName - The name of the file to use as the destination of the writer. If the file exists then it will be truncated to zero size; otherwise, a new file will be created. The output will be written to the file and is buffered.
        lineSeparator - The line separator to use with the writer.
        Returns:
        a writer with the provided specifications.
